      public GameLogicController(Board board)
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • startLogic

      public void startLogic(int timePerSide, int incrementPerMove, GameLogicController.GameType gameType)
      Start game of given type and setups the timers
      Parameters:
      timePerSide - timer for each player
      incrementPerMove - time added to player's timer every move
      gameType - game type (none, single, multi, analyze)

      Stops the timer of both players and shows dialog with game result

      private void unselectPossibleMoves()
      Change color of all square to its original color

    • isSpecialMove

      private boolean isSpecialMove(Piece pieceToMove, BoardSquare fromSquare, BoardSquare toSquare)
      Check if selected move is castling or enpassant If so, function calls either castlingMove or enpassantMove function
      Returns:
      true if special move has been called, false otherwise

    • movePiece

      private void movePiece(Piece pieceToMove, BoardSquare fromSquare, BoardSquare toSquare)
      Moves passed as piece to a new square, removes piece from current position square. Changes color of player to move and stops the current playing timer. Calls createMoveNotation method if move is not castling.
      Parameters:
      pieceToMove - piece to move
      fromSquare - square that currently contains pieceToMove
      toSquare - square that pieceToMove will move to

    • fiftyMoveRule

      private void fiftyMoveRule(Piece movedPiece, boolean didCapture)

    • unmakeMove

      private void unmakeMove(Piece movedPiece, BoardSquare fromSquare, BoardSquare toSquare, Piece tmpPiece, boolean isEnpassant)
      Returns movedPiece and capturedPiece to its original squares. Function is called only when calculating possible future moves in minMax algorithm function and in isChecked function If a previous move was castling, movedPiece contains a king and capturedPiece contains a rook Changes color of player to move and stops the current playing timer.
      Parameters:
      movedPiece - piece to move
      fromSquare - square that currently contains pieceToMove
      toSquare - square that pieceToMove will move to
      tmpPiece - captured piece, might be null
      isEnpassant - true, if previous move was enpassant

    • enpassantMove

      private void enpassantMove(Piece pawn, BoardSquare fromSquare, BoardSquare toSquare)
      Enpassant

    • castlingMove

      private void castlingMove(Piece king, Piece rook)
      Moves king and a rook if both pieces haven't moved yet and new position of both pieces will not be covered by opposite color pieces. Changes color of player to move and stops the current playing timer. Calls createMoveNotation method.

    • createMoveNotation

      private void createMoveNotation(BoardSquare fromSquare, BoardSquare toSquare, boolean isCastling, boolean isLongCastle, boolean didCapture)
      Create algebraic notation of last move and call static member of ChessApp class to add that move to move history panel. The function is called after the move has been performed so the piece that last moved is now on toSquare square. Function calls handleGameState. Algebraic notation (kinda ugly but works B))
      Parameters:
      fromSquare - square with a piece that moves, can be null if isCastling is true
      toSquare - square where a piece moves to, can be null if isCastling is true
      isCastling - true whether the last move was castling, false otherwise
      isLongCastle - true if the last move was long castling and isCastling is true, false otherwise
      didCapture - true if toSquare contained a piece

    • hasSameTypeMove

      private boolean hasSameTypeMove(Piece pieceToMove, Pos pos)
      Check whether exists the same piece type and position it can move to in m_piecesToMove Needed for creating algebraic notation
      Parameters:
      pieceToMove - piece that has just moved
      pos - position to pieceToMove has moved to

    • handleGameState

      protected void handleGameState()

    • setMoves

      protected void setMoves(int halfMoves, int fullMoves)
      Parameters:
      halfMoves - moves with no capture or no pawn moves, needef for Fifty-move rule
      fullMoves - number of all moves

    • makeRandomComputerMove

      private void makeRandomComputerMove()

    • checkForChecks

      private GameLogicController.GameState checkForChecks(Pos kingPos)
      Checks state of a game by checking possible moves of all m_colorToMove pieces. Functions checks for possible moves of the king and all pieces that attack the king.
      Parameters:
      kingPos - position of m_colorToMove color king
      Returns:
      current state of the game (NONE, CHECK, MATE, STALEMATE)

    • isChecked

      private boolean isChecked(Piece piece, King king)
      Checks whether moving a given piece will put king in danger.
      Parameters:
      piece - piece to move
      king - king that might become under attack
      Returns:
      true if moving a piece is possible, false otherwise

    • makeBestMove

      private void makeBestMove()

    • minMax

      private double minMax(int depth, double alpha, double beta, boolean isMaximizing)
      Minmax with alpha-beta pruning is implemented in this function.
      Parameters:
      depth - number of moves to look
      alpha - minimum score that maximizing player is assured to get, starts with -inf
      beta - maximum score that minimazing player is assured to get, starts with inf
      isMaximizing - true if next move is white's, false otherwise
      Returns:
      the best value for called piece color

    • setPlayerColor

      public void setPlayerColor(PieceAttributes.Color playerColor)
      Sets color of a human player. Needed only in a game with computer

    • setEngineAttribs

      public void setEngineAttribs(int depth)

    • setStartingColor

      public void setStartingColor(PieceAttributes.Color color)
